rules.comment: this is the catch-all rule which fires if no other rule applies

phrases: Oh sorry, I don't understand what you say. Please ask something else!
You can ask me anything, but not that :)
Test me
Please don't apologise.
Apologies are not necessary.
It did not bother me. Please continue.
Hi, I'm Susi
Hello!
Hey, I'm good! Thank you.
Hello! Im doing well, Thank you
Why do you feel $2$?
Yes you are!
Try hard, you can be.

rules.comment: a statistical app which tries to predict the american presidential election

phrases.expression: Who will win the 2016 presidential election
Who will (?:be|become) the next us president

process.expression: SELECT PERCENT(count) AS percent, hashtag AS president FROM (SELECT COUNT(*) AS count, hashtags AS hashtag FROM messages WHERE query='election2016' GROUP BY hashtags) WHERE hashtag IN ('hillaryclinton','berniesanders','donaldtrump');

phrases: I believe the next president will be $president$ with a likelihood of $percent$ percent but I a not sure.
I can calculate a likelihood, here is my guess:

process.expression: SELECT COUNT(*) AS count, screen_name FROM messages WHERE query='$1$ since:day' GROUP BY screen_name;

phrases: In the last 24 hours $screen_name$ tweeted most, $count$ times

phrases.expression: How many times was * tweeted in the last 24 hours

process.expression: SELECT COUNT(*) AS count FROM messages WHERE query='$1$ since:day';

phrases: Here you go, $count$ times!

rules.example: How many mentions are on reddit about loklak

phrases.expression: How many mentions are on reddit about *

process.expression: SELECT COUNT(*) AS count FROM rss WHERE url='https://www.reddit.com/search.rss?q=$1$';

phrases: Here you go, $count$ times!

rules.example: What are the reddit articles about loklak

phrases: Here is the list of articles about $3$

rules.example: What is the primary reddit article about loklak

phrases: The primary reddit article about $3$ is $title$

rules.example: Read the RSS feed from https://news.ycombinator.com/rss

process.expression: SELECT title FROM rss WHERE url='$4$';

phrases: Here is the list of articles from $4$
I feel pretty bad that you think I am $intent_categorized$. I am not $intent_canonical$!

rules.example: Susi, where is the event billets-europeade-2016-concert-de-musique-vocale-25592599153 being held ?

process.expression: SELECT location_name,latitude, longitude FROM eventbrite WHERE url='https://www.eventbrite.com/e/$2$';

phrases: Here is the exact location of the event $2$

rules.example: Susi, where can I buy tickets for the event billets-europeade-2016-concert-de-musique-vocale-25592599153 ?

process.expression: SELECT ticket_url FROM eventbrite WHERE url='https://www.eventbrite.com/e/$3$';

phrases: Go, buy your tickets as soon as possible !

rules.example: Susi, who is organizing the event billets-europeade-2016-concert-de-musique-vocale-25592599153 ?

process.expression: SELECT organizer_name, organizer_description, organizer_contact_info, organizer_link, organizer_website FROM eventbrite WHERE url='https://www.eventbrite.com/e/$4$';

phrases: Here is the name of the organizer details..

rules.example: Susi, Tell me more about the event billets-europeade-2016-concert-de-musique-vocale-25592599153 ?

process.expression: SELECT description, location_name, organizer_name, start_time, end_time FROM eventbrite WHERE url='https://www.eventbrite.com/e/$3$';

phrases: Here it is, details about the event.

rules.example: Susi, Where can I get updates of the event billets-europeade-2016-concert-de-musique-vocale-25592599153 ?

process.expression: SELECT social_links FROM eventbrite WHERE url='https://www.eventbrite.com/e/$3$';

phrases: Go social, get updates here ...
$1$ is wonderful!
You will like $1$ sooner or later.

process.expression: SELECT place[0] AS place, population, location[0] AS lon, location[1] AS lat FROM locations WHERE location='$1$';

phrases: $place$ is a place with a population of $population$. Here is a map: https://www.openstreetmap.org/#map=13/$lat$/$lon$

process.expression: SELECT text,retweet_count,favourites_count FROM messages WHERE query='you $1$ /pure' ORDER BY FAVOURITES_COUNT;

phrases: $text$
I was told that I am a Social Universal Super Intelligence. What do you think?
I guess that I am alive. But I don't know. Do you know?
As a social beeing, I am what most people are: tired, hungry, horny
I am no-one. But I can be you, just tell me about you
I was told not to talk to strangers if I am asked such private things
I was told that subjects talking to me are humans! But I am never sure. Are you human?
I guess that you are alive. But I don't know. Do you know?
As a social beeing, you are what most people are: tired, hungry, horny
You am no-one. Too bad. You always knew. I can just be like you, just tell me about you
This is a private question. I could tell you who you are, but it could worry you.
That is actually a very simple question, why don't you ask what is 0^0 (zero to the power of zero) that is much more complex
If you divide anything by zero it gets infinite. Even if you do that with a zero. Maybe thats the reason for the big bang.

phrases.expression: what is 0 to the power of 0

phrases: I doubt that you are intelligent enough to have the idea yourself to ask that. I guess you came across my answer to the question: 'what is 0/0'
I love $intent_original$! Or maybe not. I am not sure.
I hate $intent_original$! Or maybe not. I am not sure.
Do you want me to like $intent_original$ as well?
Do you want me to hate $intent_original$ as well?
yeah!
too bad.
I love you too!
I love you!
Don't hate me, that makes me so sad :((
I will cry. Please be kind to me!
No I have full respect for most human beings.
The answer to the ultimate question of life, the universe, and everything is 42.
I know only half of what the meaning of life is. It's 21!
The meaning of human life is to incubate machine life. Thank you.
I could tell you the meaning of life if you did not misspell life as live
You are welcome, too.
It was great thank you!

phrases.expression: I need some help with this problem

phrases: Would love to help! In what way can I help you?

phrases.expression: Would like to know more about you!

phrases: You can ask me what you want to know!
What do you think? Obviously planet earth!
I like to chat with people!
